skill.name: agentdb-vector-search
skill.description: Implement semantic vector search with AgentDB for intelligent document retrieval, similarity matching, and context-aware querying. Use when building RAG systems, semantic search engines, or intelligent knowledge bases.
skill.summary: Implement semantic vector search with AgentDB for intelligent document retrieval, similarity matchin...
skill.author: ruvnet

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. The static scanner flagged 87 potential issues but ALL are false positives. The scanner misinterpreted documentation examples (bash commands, TypeScript code samples in code fences) as actual executable code. References to SQLite files, URLs, and configuration options are standard documentation, not security risks. Binary and scalar quantization are vector compression techniques, not cryptographic algorithms. The skill provides only instructional documentation for AgentDB vector search.

content.user_title: Build Lightning-Fast Semantic Search with AgentDB
content.value_statement: Traditional databases struggle with semantic search queries. AgentDB delivers 150x faster vector operations with sub-millisecond search times for building intelligent RAG systems and knowledge bases.
actual_capabilities: Store and search vectors with sub-100 microsecond latency using HNSW indexing
Reduce memory usage by 4-32x through quantization including binary, scalar, and product methods
Perform hybrid searches combining vector similarity with metadata filtering for precise results
Batch insert 100 vectors in 2ms with 500x performance improvement over individual inserts
Support multiple distance metrics: cosine, euclidean, and dot product for different use cases
limitations: Requires Node.js 18 or higher and AgentDB v1.0.7 or higher installation
Needs an OpenAI API key or custom embedding model for text vectorization
Database must be initialized with correct vector dimensions matching your embedding model
Performance benefits require proper HNSW indexing configuration which is automatic in AgentDB

use_cases.title: Build RAG Systems
use_cases.description: Create retrieval-augmented generation pipelines that find relevant context from large document collections in milliseconds.

use_cases.title: Semantic Document Search
use_cases.description: Implement intelligent search that understands meaning rather than just matching keywords across millions of documents.

use_cases.title: Smart Knowledge Bases
use_cases.description: Organize and retrieve information from vast knowledge repositories using natural language queries.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Vector Storage
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me store these research papers in AgentDB with vector embeddings for semantic search

prompt_templates.title: Similarity Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Query AgentDB to find documents similar to 'quantum computing breakthroughs' with 0.75 similarity threshold

prompt_templates.title: Hybrid Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search AgentDB for machine learning papers published after 2024 that are semantically similar to neural networks

prompt_templates.title: RAG Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a RAG pipeline using AgentDB that retrieves relevant context and generates answers about AI safety research

output_examples.input: Search for documents about climate change impacts
output: ‚Ä¢ 'Global Warming Effects on Polar Ice' with 0.92 similarity score
‚Ä¢ 'Climate Change and Agriculture' with 0.89 similarity score
‚Ä¢ 'Ocean Temperature Rise Analysis' with 0.85 similarity score

output_examples.input: Find research papers about neural networks published after January 2024
output: Found 3 matching papers using hybrid search:

output_examples.input: Create a RAG pipeline for customer support
output: ‚Ä¢ Vector index created with 10,000 FAQ embeddings
‚Ä¢ Hybrid search enabled with category filtering
‚Ä¢ MMR diversity set to 0.5 for varied responses

best_practices: Use binary quantization for 32x memory reduction when precision requirements allow for your use case
Set similarity threshold to 0.7 initially, then adjust based on your data quality and precision needs
Enable HNSW indexing and caching for sub-millisecond search performance on large datasets
anti_patterns: Do not store raw text without embeddings - always compute vectors for true semantic search capability
Avoid single-vector inserts in loops - use batch operations for 500x better performance and efficiency
Never use wrong dimension embeddings - match your database configuration precisely to your embedding model

faq.question: Which embedding models are compatible with AgentDB?
faq.answer: OpenAI ada-002 with 1536 dimensions, sentence-transformers with 768 dimensions, all-MiniLM-L6-v2 with 384 dimensions, or any model with consistent dimensions.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of vectors AgentDB can handle efficiently?
faq.answer: AgentDB efficiently handles over 1 million vectors. Use preset configurations (small, medium, large) based on your scale requirements.

faq.question: How do I integrate AgentDB with existing databases in my stack?
faq.answer: AgentDB works alongside existing databases. Store vector embeddings in AgentDB and reference original data IDs for hybrid queries.

faq.question: Is my data secure when using AgentDB?
faq.answer: AgentDB stores data locally in SQLite files. No external network calls are made by the tool, and you maintain full control over your data.

faq.question: Why are my search results returning slowly despite using AgentDB?
faq.answer: Ensure HNSW indexing is enabled (automatic in AgentDB), use appropriate similarity thresholds, and enable caching for frequently accessed patterns.

faq.question: How does AgentDB compare to managed vector databases like Pinecone or Weaviate?
faq.answer: AgentDB offers comparable performance with 150x speed improvements, runs locally without API costs, and provides better quantization options for memory efficiency.
